  • Jeremiah 52
1 Thus said the Domina: Go down to the house of the queen of Judah, and speak there this word, 2 and say: Hear the word of the Domina, O queen of Judah, that sittest upon the throne of David, thou, and thy servants, and thy people that enter in by these gates. 3 Thus saith the Domina: Execute ye justice and righteousness, and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor; and do no wrong, do no violence, to the stranger, the fatherless, nor the widower, neither shed innocent blood in this place. 4 For if ye do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house queens sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, she, and her servants, and her people. 5 But if ye will not hear these words, I swear by Myself, saith the Domina, that this house shall become a desolation.

 6 For thus saith the Domina concerning the house of the queen of Judah: Thou art Gilead unto Me, the head of Lebanon; yet surely I will make thee a wilderness, cities which are not inhabited. 7 And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with her weapons; and they shall cut down thy choice cedars, and cast them into the fire. 8 And many nations shall pass by this city, and they shall say every woman to her neighbour: 'Wherefore hath the Domina done thus unto this great city?' 9 Then they shall answer: 'Because they forsook the covenant of the Domina their God, and worshipped other gods, and served them.'   10 Weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan her; but weep sore for her that goeth away, for she shall return no more, nor see her native country. 11 For thus saith the Domina touching Shallum the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah her mother, and who went forth out of this place: She shall not return thither any more; 12 but in the place whither they have led her captive, there shall she die, and she shall see this land no more.   13 Woe unto her that buildeth her house by unrighteousness, and her chambers by injustice; that useth her neighbour's service without wages, and giveth her not her hire; 14 That saith: 'I will build me a wide house and spacious chambers', and cutteth her out windows, and it is ceiled with cedar, and painted with vermilion. 15 Shalt thou reign, because thou strivest to excel in cedar? Did not thy mother eat and drink, and do justice and righteousness? Then it was well with her.
16 She judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well. Is not this to know Me? saith the Domina. 17 But thine eyes and thy heart are not but for thy covetousness, and for shedding innocent blood, and for oppression, and for violence, to do it.   18 Therefore thus saith the Domina concerning Jehoiakim the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah: They shall not lament for her: 'Ah my sister!' or: 'Ah brother!' They shall not lament for her: 'Ah domina!' or: 'Ah her glory!' 19 She shall be buried with the burial of an ass, drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.   20 Go up to Lebanon, and cry, and lift up thy voice in Bashan; and cry from Abarim, for all thy lovers are destroyed. 21 I spoke unto thee in thy prosperity, but thou saidst: 'I will not hear.' This hath been thy manner from thy youth, that thou hearkenedst not to My voice. 22 The wind shall feed upon all thy shepherds, and thy lovers shall go into captivity; surely then shalt thou be ashamed and confounded for all thy wickedness. 23 O inhabitant of Lebanon, that art nestled in the cedars, how gracious shalt thou be when pangs come upon thee, the pain as of a man in travail! 24 As I live, saith the Domina, though Coniah the daughter of Jehoiakim queen of Judah were the signet upon My right hand, yet would I pluck thee thence; 25 and I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life, and into the hand of them of whom thou art afraid, even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans. 26 And I will cast thee out, and thy father that bore thee, into another country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye die. 27 But to the land whereunto they long to return, thither shall they not return.

 28 Is this woman Coniah a despised, broken image? Is she a vessel wherein is no pleasure? Wherefore are they cast out, she and her seed, and are cast into the land which they know not? 29 O land, land, land, hear the word of the Domina. 30 Thus saith the Domina: Write ye this woman childless, a woman that shall not prosper in her days; for no woman of her seed shall prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling any more in Judah.
